body: @gdorsi can you try the latest version? see if this is potentially resolved.

Nope, the last version doesn't solve my issue.

If this can help, I tried to debug the problem and I found that passing `keepIsValid: true` to the reset options solves the issue.

That's because `_stateFlags.mount` [here](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/master/src/logic/createFormControl.ts#L1144) becomes `true` instead of `false` enabling the `formState` updates.

I have tried to reproduce the problem outside of my application, but without success.
Using `const { formState: { isDirty } } = useFormContext()` instead of `const { isDirty } = useFormState()` also solves the issue.
@gdorsi can you share a codesandbox for the use case?

Do you mean when the warning should be fired or to try to reproduce the bug?

Because I already tried to reproduce the bug, but even doing the same things it doesn't happen outside my application...

> Do you mean when the warning should be fired or to try to reproduce the bug?

yes, and what's the warning?

This could be related to execution order with `useFormState` after `reset`.

The following CSB showcase the latest minor version can have `reset` inside `onSubmit`: 

https://codesandbox.io/s/modest-meadow-ohbdc?file=/src/App.tsx

> That's because _stateFlags.mount here becomes true instead of false enabling the formState updates.

mount state is required to revalidate all inputs after resetting the entire form.

That's what i meant for "fire a warning":

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-reset-v7-forked-9rmzo?file=/src/index.js

see my CSB above and this release note: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/releases/tag/v7.22.0

> It's recommended to not invoke reset inside onReset or onSubmit callback.

I may keep the recommended part tho. After all, it's better to execute something until the entire form is finished reset and re-register all the new/old inputs.

I've updated my CSB in order to match how I use react-hook-form in my application:

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-reset-v7-forked-9rmzo?file=/src/index.js

Here everything works fine, inside my application (where I'm using the v7.22.0) it's not.

I've opened a "Feature Request" instead of a "Bug" issue because without a repro we can't do so much to solve the problem.

Also I think that if you have `rules` to follow having something that tells you that you are making a mistake helps alot.

Anyway thanks for the huge help, very appreciated :)

thanks, @gdorsi we used to have `console.warn` in the dev build but it creates noise that some devs like and others don't, hence with v7 we have removed all the warnings. on top of that, striping log and warning is another headache with env, especially we have ESM, UMD, and CJS making build even more difficult. so ideally if we can find the root cause or anyone can reproduce the issue, let's try to improve the DX by default instead of introducing more logs in the library.

> Here everything works fine, inside my application (where I'm using the v7.22.0) it's not.

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-reset-v7-forked-9rmzo?file=/src/index.js

anyone has a similar issue and has a reproducible code sandbox, let us know, so we can look into it. 

I will keep this issue open for a few days and see if others have similar issues.

> it creates noise that some devs like and others don't

And what if we create an eslint plugin?
Do you think it would be worth it?

~~Ha! I have a repro!~~

~~https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-reset-v7-forked-gnf36?file=/src/index.js~~

~~Also we have too much renders here.~~

EDIT: the package version was wrong...

I have a working repro of the bug:

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-reset-v7-forked-gnf36?file=/src/index.js

The steps to reproduce the issue are:
- Edit the input
- submit
- edit again

The isDirty should remain `false`
